bug.author: ry
bug.summary: resize_image_with_crop_or_pad doesn't work with input pipelines
bug.description: Because tf.image.resize_image_with_crop_or_pad() requires its input to have a fully defined shape, it's not useful as part of an input pipeline since the size of images loaded will not be known in advance. queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(filenames) reader = tf.WholeFileReader() _, contents = reader.read(queue) image = tf.image.decode_jpeg(contents, channels=3) cropped = tf.image.resize_image_with_crop_or_pad(image, 224, 224) Ideally the above would work...

comments.comment: I needed to use the method resize_image_with_crop_or_pad as part of an input pipeline and ran into a similar issue. I'm not yet proficient enough with TensorFlow to tell if this is useful. I made a small workaround for personal use. If this workaround would be a route to use in fixing this issue I'd be happy to update the tests, docs and change out the logic in the existing implementation. If anyone can advise on its usefulness I'd appreciate the feedback. <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/eerwitt/51aba4bffd9ddd5c581c#file-resize_image_with_crop_or_pad_pipeline-py-L6>Example Implementation of resize_image_with_crop_or_pad</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/eerwitt>@eerwitt</denchmark-link> It works flawlessly! thanks. <denchmark-code> img_bytes = tf.read_file(fp) img_u8 = tf.image.decode_jpeg(img_bytes, channels=ch) image = tf.image.convert_image_dtype(img_u8, dtype=tf.float32) img_cropped = resize_image_with_crop_or_pad(image,img_size[1],img_size[0]) </denchmark-code>
So any news to solve the problem ?
Other than the workaround posted above, no.

Here is a monkey patching module based on PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2737>#2737</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/gaohuazuo/4093eee2aee4d5b8746bff698506ee57#file-resize_image_patch-py>resize_image_patch.py</denchmark-link>
Note
Remember to pass argument dynamic_shape=True Input image must have static rank of 3. This can be done by tf.Tensor.set_shape([None, None, None])
Looks like the issue has been fixed by PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2737>#2737</denchmark-link> . Maybe this issue could be closed?
